name: Partner not filed in answer in time
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)), 

Your ((partner)) has not submitted the 'answer' form to the court in time. This means you can continue with ((isDivorce??your divorce))((isDissolution??ending your civil partnership)). 

 #What happens next
The next step in the ((isDivorce??divorce process))((isDissolution??process to end your civil partnership)) is to apply for a ‘conditional order’. You have to wait until ((date of response)) until you can apply. You will receive a notification with details of how you can apply.

Dividing your money and property
Dividing money and property is dealt with separately to the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)).

It’s usually more straightforward and less expensive if you agree with your ((partner)) on how to divide your money and property. Get help agreeing: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/mediation

If you do agree then you can make the agreement legally binding. This is known as asking the court to make a ‘consent order’. Read more about consent orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/apply-for-consent-order

If you disagree then you can ask the court to decide for you. This is known as applying for a ‘financial order’. Read more about financial orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/get-court-to-decide

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
subject: Your ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)): important update
